attributes.action: Reduce the price of car insurance policies.
attributes.additional_details: There is a horrendous cost of living crisis Britain is battling through at the moment. The government needs to try and support the people who need it most, as much as they can. We believe by enforcing this within insurance businesses it can help stop greedy corporations receiving large profits while the rest of society suffers. An example being, Admiral said its group pre-tax profit had increased 4% during the first half of the year to £233.9m. Another statistic to illustrate this unjust situation may be, On Wednesday, the Office for National Statistics revealed that the quoted price for car insurance premiums across the industry had risen by 53.4% over the 12 months to July. Reference The Guardian Wednesday 16/08/2023.
attributes.background: Implement a capped price on car insurance depending on the valuef of the car. For example, a car worth £1000 pay 10% of that value as insurance (experienced drivers). Put in a 40% capped price on the car depending on the engine size of the car price of the car and age of the driver (young drivers).

rejection.details:

Establish a Commission to investigate extortionate Car Insurance price rises: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/644067
